definition: to team up (with)/to put a team together
surname Zu
to form/to organize/group/team/classifier for sets, series, groups of people, batteries
squadron/team/group/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Do we need a Squad to take part in this event?
sentences.chinese: 請問我們需要組隊參加這個活動嗎？
在組隊生還模式中贏得30場比賽。

sentences.english: There is fire and eye team skills '.
sentences.chinese: 而且火眼有是組隊技能，好呀。

sentences.english: Yellow and White Party Skills now have animations.
sentences.chinese: 黃法和白法的組隊技能現在有了用武之地。

sentences.english: Ice dancing is again for couples consisting of a woman and a man skating together.
sentences.chinese: 冰上舞蹈同樣由一男一女兩名選手組隊參賽。

sentences.english: Those people who had joint the group, they can erase their poster.
sentences.chinese: 那些後來組隊了板油，可以將自己的信息更改。

sentences.english: Leonard:Come on, you need a four-person team. We're four people.
sentences.chinese: 別這樣啊，必須四人組隊，我們剛好四個人。

sentences.english: The Team That Slays Together… Win 30 matches in Team Slayers.
sentences.chinese: 在組隊殺戮者模式中贏得30場比賽。

sentences.english: Player but individual or group group undertake clean-out .
sentences.chinese: 玩家可個人或組隊進行掃蕩。

sentences.english: Groups or raids can switch specs during a run by using this item.
sentences.chinese: 在組隊或副本中玩家可以通過召喚這樣的物事來切換。

sentences.english: The Dragon and the Tiger will unite one day hopefully to make great team.
sentences.chinese: 總有一天，龍和虎將會統一併組隊在一起。

sentences.english: Gamers can also unlock current NBA players to create unique match-ups between legends and current stars.
sentences.chinese: 你還能挑選現役球員和傳奇球星們組隊進行比賽。

sentences.english: For Team Sealed, players share the boosters they open.
sentences.chinese: 組隊現開中，同隊牌手共享這些補充包。

sentences.english: For Team Draft, players do not share the drafted cards.
sentences.chinese: 組隊輪抽中，同隊牌手不共享這些抽到的牌。

sentences.english: I have carefully analyzed when the 10th National Game team formed.
sentences.chinese: 在十運會組隊的工作上，我仔細分析了人選。

sentences.english: Teaming up with others is the key to success, so don't go alone.
sentences.chinese: 與其他人組隊冒險是成功的關鍵，因此不要單練。

definition: to go with sb/to form companionships
to sign up/to enter one's name/to apply/to register/to enroll/to enlist
to agree (on a meeting place, date etc)/to reach agreement/to make an appointment
to call/to appeal
at the same time/simultaneously
party/gathering/to meet/to get together
to buy tickets/(Tw) to buy votes (in an election)
squadron/team/group/CL:個|个[ge4]
to ride (in a vehicle)/to get a lift/to hitch-hike
to participate/to take part/to join
to report for duty/to check in/to register
group buying/collective buying/buying by a group of individuals who negotiate a discount for the group
member of same class, team, work group etc/teammate
to join in the fun/to get in on the action/(fig.) to butt in/to create more trouble
to apply (for a job)/to reply to a job advertisement
quota/number of places/place (in an institution, a group etc)
